definition: pluralism, philosophical doctrine that the universe consists of different substances
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)

sentences.english: Pluralism of knowledge is based on this foundation.
sentences.chinese: 知识的多元论就是奠基于这个基础上的。

sentences.english: This is clearly the position of cultural pluralism.
sentences.chinese: 这显然就是文化多元论的立场。

sentences.english: This method to read science is also called metascientific pluralism.
sentences.chinese: 齐曼对科学的这种解读方法也被称作元科学多元论。

sentences.english: I am in favor of pluralism of human culture.
sentences.chinese: 我是主张人类文化产生多元论的。

sentences.english: There’s a danger to pluralism of that sort, too.
sentences.chinese: 这也存在着多元论的危险。

definition: monism, belief that the universe is made of a single substance
ontology
dualism, belief that the universe is made of two different substance (e.g. mind and matter or good and evil)
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)
metaphysics
pantheism, theological theory equating God with the Universe
epistemology
positivism/empiricism
determinism
(philosophy) rationalism
deism, theological theory of God who does not interfere in the Universe
agnosticism, the philosophical doctrine that some questions about the universe are in principle unanswerable
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
scientism
rationalism
theism (the belief in the existence of God)
